intro: Erythraea leptina, commonly known as the slender erythraea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
